alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:17PM EST until December 19 at 11:48PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Caribou ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River Above Dover-Foxcroft affecting Piscataquis County. Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Piscataquis and Penobscot Counties. Penobscot At Bangor affecting Penobscot County. Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. For the Piscataquis River...including Blanchard, Dover-Foxcroft, Abbot Climate Station, Medford...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Piscataquis River above Dover-Foxcroft. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, In Dover-Foxcroft, flood waters reach the low section of Pine Street near the intersection of South Street. Parking lot and recreational field off of Moosehead Lane inundated. Backyards of properties on Grange, Greene, and Riverside Ave flooded. In Guilford, properties south of Water Street along Old Railroad Grade and River Street are surrounded by floodwaters. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 5.7 feet. - At 9.0 feet, river approaches bankfull. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 14.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.9 feet on 09/29/1909. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 330 PM EST.
